name: Idaho Edokpayi
welcome: Idaho Edokpayi is a Nigerian-American author, educator, and advocate for African literature and culture. He is known for his work in promoting African voices and stories, as well as his contributions to education and community development.
aboutMe: Idaho Edokpayi is a writer, teacher, and cultural ambassador. He has published poetry, essays, and articles that explore themes of identity, migration, and the African diaspora. Edokpayi is also recognized for his efforts in mentoring young writers and fostering cross-cultural understanding.

books.title: Songs of the Niger Delta
books.description: A collection of poems reflecting on the landscapes and people of the Niger Delta region.

books.title: Bridges Across the Atlantic
books.description: Essays on migration, identity, and the African experience in America.
